5.2. Abstract table writer classes¶

5.2.1. TableWriter class¶

class pytablewriter._table_writer.TableWriter[source]¶

Bases: pytablewriter._interface.TableWriterInterface

Abstract class of table writer.

stream¶

Stream to write the table.

table_name¶

Table name of the table.

header_list¶

List of header data to write.

value_matrix¶

Nested list of data to write.

is_padding¶

Padding an item in the table if the value is True.

is_quote_str¶

Add double quote to string in the table if the value is True.

close()[source]¶

Close the current stream.

5.3. Base table writer classes¶

5.3.1. TextTableWriter class¶

class pytablewriter._text_writer.TextTableWriter[source]¶

Bases: pytablewriter._table_writer.TableWriter, pytablewriter._interface.TextWriterInterface

Base class of table writer that text format.

column_delimiter¶

A column delimiter of a table.

char_left_side_row¶

A character of a left sides of a row.

char_right_side_row¶

A character of a right sides of a row.

char_cross_point¶

A character of crossing point of column delimiter and row delimiter.

char_opening_row¶

A character of the first line of a table.

char_header_row_separator¶

A character of a separator line of the header and the body of the table.

char_value_row_separator¶

A character of a row separator line of the table.

char_closing_row¶

A character of the last line of a table.

is_write_header¶

Write a header of the table if the value is True.

is_write_header_separator_row¶

Write a header separator line of the table if the value is True.

is_write_value_separator_row¶

Write row separator line(s) of the table if the value is True.

is_write_opening_row¶

Write opening line of the table if the value is True.

is_write_closing_row¶

Write closing line of the table if the value is True.

Character attributes that compose a table

close()¶

Close the current stream.

write_null_line()[source]¶

Write a null line to the stream.

write_table()[source]¶

Write a table to the stream.

5.3.2. IndentationTextTableWriter class¶

class pytablewriter._text_writer.IndentationTextTableWriter[source]¶

Bases: pytablewriter._text_writer.TextTableWriter, pytablewriter._interface.IndentationInterface

Base class of table writer that text format with indentation.

indent_string¶

String of an indent for each level.

close()¶

Close the current stream.

dec_indent_level()[source]¶

Decrement the current indent level.

inc_indent_level()[source]¶

Increment the current indent level.

set_indent_level(indent_level)[source]¶

Set the current indent level.

Parameters:indent_level (int) – New indent level.
write_null_line()¶

Write a null line to the stream.

write_table()¶

Write a table to the stream.

5.4. Concrete table writer classes¶

5.4.1. CSV table writer class¶

class pytablewriter.CsvTableWriter[source]¶

Bases: pytablewriter._text_writer.TextTableWriter

Concrete class of a table writer for CSV format.

Examples:Write a CSV table
close()¶

Close the current stream.

write_null_line()¶

Write a null line to the stream.

write_table()¶

Write a table to the stream.

5.4.2. Excel table writer class¶

class pytablewriter.ExcelTableWriter[source]¶

Bases: pytablewriter._table_writer.TableWriter, pytablewriter._interface.TextWriterInterface

Concrete class of a table writer for Excel format.

Examples:Write an Excel table
close()[source]¶

Close the current workbook.

first_data_col¶
Returns:Index of the first column of the table.
Return type:int

Note

This attributes available after execution of the write_table() method.

first_data_row¶
Returns:Index of the first row of the data (table body).
Return type:int

Note

This attributes available after execution of the write_table() method.

first_header_row¶
Returns:Index of the first row of the header.
Return type:int

Note

This attributes available after execution of the write_table() method.

last_data_col¶
Returns:Index of the last column of the table.
Return type:int

Note

This attributes available after execution of the write_table() method.

last_data_row¶
Returns:Index of the last row of the data (table body).
Return type:int

Note

This attributes available after execution of the write_table() method.

last_header_row¶
Returns:Index of the last row of the header.
Return type:int

Note

This attributes available after execution of the write_table() method.

make_worksheet(sheet_name)[source]¶

Make a worksheet to the current workbook.

Parameters:sheet_name (str) – Name of the worksheet to create. Name of the work sheet will automatically decided (like "Sheet1") if the sheet_name is empty.
open_workbook(workbook_path)[source]¶

Open workbook.

Parameters:workbook_path (str) – File path to open.
write_table()[source]¶

Write a table to the current worksheet.
